required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-invasive Modulation of Autonomic Cardiac Nervous System
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Non Invasive Vagus Nerve Stimulation on Heart Rate Variability in Healthy Subjects and on Muscle Sympathetic Nerve Activity

brief_summary.textblock: To demonstrate the effect of non invasive vagus nerve (VNS) stimulation on heart rate variability and MSNA signal.

detailed_description.textblock:
First part: Assessment of the muscle sympathetic nerve activity (MSNA) at baseline using microneurography performed on the superficial peroneal nerve.
Second part: Acquisition of the MSNA signal during non-invasive VNS and apnea. Non-invasive VNS is performed using several frequencies of stimulation. Maximal and voluntaries apnea are performed at the end of the expiration.
Continuous recording of the following parameters:
- non-invasive arterial blood pressure
- R-R interval
- electrocardiogram
- MSNA activity
- respiratory curve signal
- respiratory rate, oxygen saturation

study_design_info.masking_description: Investigators are double-blinded for both experimental procedures and data analyzes. Volunteers are blinded to the site of stimulation.

primary_outcome.description: Modulation of heart rate variability assessed through analysis of MSNA signal

secondary_outcome.description: Modulation of parasympathetic tone based on two different frequencies stimulation
To describe positive and negative patterns of MSNA response

other_outcome.measure: Profile of response of MSNA during prolonged breath hold
other_outcome.description: Modulation of MSNA activity during repetitive prolonged breath hold

arm_group.description: Each subject will be blinded and underwent 3 phases of stimulation (actives (2) and sham (1) comparators) in a randomized order .
Each subject will be blinded and underwent 3 phases of stimulation (actives (2) and sham (1) comparators) in a randomized order.

intervention.intervention_name: Modulation of muscle sympathetic nerve activity
intervention.description: Assessment of muscle sympathetic nerve signal and exposition to external non invasive modulation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers
- >18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy and breastfeeding
- smoke
- alcool/energy drinks/coffee consumption, exertion 24h before the participation

clinical_study.keyword: Heart rate variability, MSNA, vagus nerve, sympathetic nervous system
